titleStmt.title: (Copy of) list of priests and temple inventory

revisionDesc.change: Pull translation out of APIS record.

div.ab: (from) ... presbyter of the priests of Sok[nobraisis, the great god of the] famous temples [in the village of Bakchias. List] of priests and temple inventory for the current year which is the eleventh year of our lord Aurelius [Antoninus Caesar.] Among the things [in the temple there are: a] gilded [wooden shrine for Soknokonnis] and [a gilded wooden shrine for] Pnepheros, [fifteen] trumpet-shaped bronze [lampstands, ten bronze cups,] one bronze censer, [two wooden] pipes, [each with] five bronze [bands,] two [gilded] wooden platters, one bronze vessel. Among the priests, [who have, one by one, been adjudged to pay twelve drachmae and] who have, according to order, paid the the eiskritikon are: Peteësis, forty-one years old, ... [Psenam]oun[is, ... Psen]amou[nis

listBibl.bibl: P.Bacch. 3 SB VI 9337 P.Lund. III 6 BL V, 64; TM 14155; Wilcken, U., Archiv für Papyrusforschung 13 (1939) p. 233; Waddell, W. G., The classical review, Vol. 54 (1940), No 1, p. 47-48; Hombert, M., Chronique d'Égypt 14, 1939, p. 400-401; Schmidt, K. F. W., Philologische Wochenschrift (Jahrgang) 60 (No 45/48), 1940, c. 608-611; van Groningen, B. A., Museum, Maandblad voor Philologie en Geschiedenis, 47, 1940, c. 168
